snippet: Afghanistan officials asked Internet companies to block access to YouTube, where an anti-Islamic video can be viewed, and asked local officials to urge calm in the country.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and an employee of The New York Times from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Afghanistan officials asked Internet companies to block access to YouTube, where an anti-Islamic video can be viewed, and asked local officials to urge calm in the country.

headline.seo: Afghanistan Tries to Block Video and Head Off Rioting
headline.main: Afghanistan Tries to Block Video and Head Off Rioting
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Tries to Block Video and Head Off Rioting
